FARM, FARM General
40.1 FARM General
40.1.1 General Description
FARM calculates inhibition conditions based on information provided by diagnostics. Main input is the state
of each diagnostics provided by ERRM, but also non-errm (e.g. temporary) diagnostics information can be
used.
The basic functionality is provided by an implementation of the Autosar module FiM (Function Inhibition Man-
ager) with an SV speci?c extension for auxiliary inputs.

FARM, FARM Con?guration data
40.2 FARM Con?guration data
� Calibration Data
Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
C_FID_CAL_FPR_ [8] - 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
FARM Con?guration - Calibration Identi?cation - NEVER CHANGE MANUALLY
C_FID_CONF_FPR_ [9] - 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
FARM Con?guration - Con?guration Identi?cation - NEVER CHANGE MANUALLY
C_FID_COPL_INP_FID_ [...] - 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
FARM Con?guration - NEVER CHANGE MANUALLY
C_IDX_COPL_INP_FID_ [...] - 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
FARM Con?guration - NEVER CHANGE MANUALLY
The FARM con?guration depends on all available interfaces in the software release, i.e. diagnostics NC_IDX_
ERR, auxiliary inputs NC_IDX_FID and functions NC_FID.
� Warning:
? Never modify this data manually. Always use the FARM Editor.
? Calibration data may be transfered within calibration sets for the same software release. Always update
the calibration for C_FID_COPL_INP_FID[...], C_IDX_COPL_INP_FID[...] and C_FID_CAL_FPR[8] at the same
time.
? Never use the same data for different software releases.
? After changing this calibration data, only send the data at engine stop and ?ash the calibration before
continuing.
� Description:
? C_FID_CONF_FPR[9] is used by the FARM Editor to ensure that calibration is written to the correct cali-
bration ?le. This data is ?xed for one software release.
? C_FID_CAL_FPR[8] serves no functional purpose but is always updated when the FARM calibration is
changed. It allows to easily identify differences between different calibration sets without using the
FARM Editor.
? C_FID_COPL_INP_FID[...] and C_IDX_COPL_INP_FID[...] contain the functional FARM calibration data.
? The ???????? of the name is replaced by a software release speci?c string of alphanumerical characters.
It prevents data exchange between incompatible software releases (see warnings above).

40.3 AGGR adaptation: FARM
� Action De?nitions
ACTION_FARM_GetPendingPrms(IN <PRM_FID>, OUT <PRM_LV_PRMS>) Mode: O
Returns a permission identi?ed by the function identi?er index unless any linked failure is pending
Parameter Type Hex.Limits Phys.Limits Resol. Unit
PRM_FID in 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
Function identi?er of the function the permission is requested for
PRM_LV_PRMS out 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Permission of the function identi?ed by the function identi?er
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(IN <PRM_FID>, OUT <PRM_LV_PRMS>) Mode: O
Returns the activation permission for function identi?ed by the function identi?er index
Parameter Type Hex.Limits Phys.Limits Resol. Unit
PRM_FID in 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
Function identi?er of the function the permission is requested for
PRM_LV_PRMS out 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Permission of the function identi?ed by the function identi?er
ACTION_FARM_InitPendingPrms() Mode: O
Initializes the pending permissions/inhibitions for calculation of the in-use monitoring performance ratio
ACTION_FARM_ReqInit() Mode: O
Requests recalculation of all permission.
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus(IN <PRM_IDX>, IN <PRM_STATE>) Mode: O
Set the state of an auxiliary input to the fault reaction management.
Parameter Type Hex.Limits Phys.Limits Resol. Unit
PRM_IDX in 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
Index of the auxiliary input
PRM_STATE in 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
State of the auxiliary input
ACTION_FARM_TriggerOnEvent(IN <PRM_IDX>, IN <PRM_STATE_OLD>, IN <PRM_STATE_NEW>) Mode: O
This action trigs the FARM to update on event
Parameter Type Hex.Limits Phys.Limits Resol. Unit
PRM_IDX in 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
Diagnostic symtom instance
PRM_STATE_OLD in 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
Diagnostic status
PRM_STATE_NEW in 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
Diagnostic status

FARM, AGGR adaptation: FARM
ACTION_FARM_TriggerOnPending(IN <PRM_IDX>) Mode: O
Revokes the affected pending-permissions for calculation of the in-use monitoring performance ratio
Parameter Type Hex.Limits Phys.Limits Resol. Unit
PRM_IDX in 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
Diagnostic symtom instance
� General Information
This modules provides the EMS2 interfaces of FARM.
Note: The initialization and recurrent function is provided for integration in EMS2 systems. In Autosar/
PowerSAR systems, the functions FiM_Init/FiM_MainFunction are called directly.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at RST:
FiM_Init(NULL)
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: 10 ms (lowest available priority)
� Function Description
Call FiM_MainFunction()
40.3.1 ACTION_FARM_GetPermission
This ACTION returns the permission PRM_LV_PRMS of the functionality identi?ed by PRM_FID. It can be called
at any time.
Permissions are always synchronized with the state of ERRM (Error Management) with one exception: Af-
ter major transitions within ERRM inhibitions (not granted permissions) may be delayed by 500 ms. While
synchronized LV_FID_READY is 1, during the re-initialization it is 0.
40.3.2 ACTION_FARM_TriggerOnEvent
This ACTION is used by ERRM to notify FARM about the chance of diagnostics states. It must not be called by
any other functionality.
40.3.3 ACTION_FARM_ReqInit
This ACTION requests complete initialization of all permissions calculated by FARM. Usually the permissions
are continuoulsy synchronized with ERRM, after major transitions this ACTION can be used.
40.3.4 ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus
FARM can calculate permissions not only based on ERRM data but also based on other inputs. FARM expects
them via this ACTION.
40.3.5 ACTION_FARM_InitPendingPrms
This action initializes the pending-inhibitions buffer of FARM. To be called when pending errors may vanish, i.e.,
at the beginning of a new driving cycle and when error memory is cleared. Non-vanishing pending shall be
re-reported through ACTION_FARM_TriggerOnPending.

FARM, AGGR adaptation: FARM
40.3.6 ACTION_FARM_TriggerOnPending
The index of every pending symptom shall be reported at least once each driving cycle through this AC-
TION.
40.3.7 ACTION_FARM_GetPendingPrms
Returns a permission which is calculated from the pending state of all symptoms that affect the function
identi?er. In case of inhibition (return value 0), the calculation of the in-use monitoring performance ratio shall
be stopped.

FARM, FARM auxiliary input handler
40.4 FARM auxiliary input handler
� Description:
This module provides an input interface for non ERRM (Error Management) data to the FARM (Fault Reaction
Management). It does not include any visible data.

� Import actions:
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus(IN <PRM_IDX>, IN <PRM_STATE>)
� General Information
This module provides various Auxiliary Inputs to the Fault Reaction Management.
Supported:
NC_IDX_FID_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD: Battery voltage out of range
NC_IDX_FID_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD_1: Battery voltage out of range
NC_IDX_FID_OBD_ES_KEY_ON: Ignition key on, engine stopped
NC_IDX_FID_OBD_PWL: Power latch
NC_IDX_FID_OBD_WKU: Wake-up
Requested con?guration values for battery voltage detection:
under-voltage: NC_VB_H_RES_OBD_INH_MIN_L = 9.0 V
hysteresis for under voltage: NC_VB_H_RES_OBD_INH_MAX_L = 9.5 V
hysteresis for over- voltage: NC_VB_H_RES_OBD_INH_MIN_H = 16.0 V
over-voltage: NC_VB_H_RES_OBD_INH_MAX_H = 16.5V
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at reset:
/* if calibrated switch off OBD-diagnosis due to
battery voltage out of range*/
If (C_T_DLY_CDN_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD <> 0.0s)
Then
T_DLY_CDN_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD = C_T_DLY_CDN_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus
(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD,40h)
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus
(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD_1,40h)
Endif
/* if calibrated switch off OBD-diagnosis after wake up*/
If ( C_T_DLY_CDN_OBD_WKU <> 0.0s)
Then
T_DLY_CDN_OBD_WKU = C_T_DLY_CDN_OBD_WKU

11385Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without
expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
FARM, FARM auxiliary input handler (Appl. Inc.)
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_WKU,40h)
Endif
at LV_IGK 1->0:
/* start post-run */
T_DLY_CDN_OBD_PWL = C_T_DLY_CDN_OBD_PWL
If C_T_DLY_CDN_OBD_PWL <> 0.0s
Then
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_PWL,40h)
/* OBD-diagnosis off during post run*/
Endif
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: 10 ms (before calculation of FARM)
� Function Description
/* check battery out of voltage */
If(1) VP_PWR[0] > NC_VB_H_RES_OBD_INH_MAX_L
/* battery above hysteresis for under-voltage */
and
VP_PWR[0] < NC_VB_H_RES_OBD_INH_MIN_H
/* battery below hysteresis for over-voltage */
Then(1)
If(2) T_DLY_CDN_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD <> 0.0s
Then(2)
T_DLY_CDN_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD = T_DLY_CDN_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD -0.01s
If(3) T_DLY_CDN_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD = 0.0s
Then(3)
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus
(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD,0) /* OBD-diagnosis on */
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus
(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD_1,0) /* OBD-diagnosis on */
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
Else(1)
If(2) VP_PWR[0] < NC_VB_H_RES_OBD_INH_MIN_L
/* battery below under-voltage */
or
VP_PWR[0] > NC_VB_H_RES_OBD_INH_MAX_H
/* battery above over-voltage */
Then(2)
T_DLY_CDN_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD = C_T_DLY_CDN_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD
If(3) T_DLY_CDN_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD <> 0.0s
Then(3)
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus
(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD,40h)/* OBD-diagnosis off */
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus
(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_BAT_NOT_VLD_1,40h)/* OBD-diagnosis off */
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
Endif(1)
/* after wake-up */
If(1) LV_IGK = 1
or LV_ES = 0
or T_DLY_CDN_OBD_WKU <> C_T_DLY_CDN_OBD_WKU
Then(1)
File: 15T01401.00C
11386Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without
expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
FARM, FARM auxiliary input handler (Appl. Inc.)
If(2) T_DLY_CDN_OBD_WKU <> 0.0s
Then(2)
T_DLY_CDN_OBD_WKU = T_DLY_CDN_OBD_WKU - 0.01s
If(3) T_DLY_CDN_OBD_WKU = 0.0s
Then(3)
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus
(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_WKU,0) / * OBD-diagnosis on */
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
Endif(1)
/* Engine stopped and ignition key on */
If(1) LV_IGK = 1
and LV_ES = 1
and T_DLY_CDN_OBD_ES_KEY_ON <> C_T_DLY_CDN_OBD_ES_KEY_ON
Then(1)
T_DLY_CDN_OBD_ES_KEY_ON = C_T_DLY_CDN_OBD_ES_KEY_ON
If(2) T_DLY_CDN_OBD_ES_KEY_ON <> 0.0s
Then(2)
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_ES_KEY_ON,40h)
/* OBD-diagnosis off */
Endif(2)
Else(1)
If(2) T_DLY_CDN_OBD_ES_KEY_ON <> 0.0s
Then(2)
T_DLY_CDN_OBD_ES_IGK_ON = T_DLY_CDN_OBD_ES_IGK_ON -0.01s
If(3) T_DLY_CDN_OBD_ES_IGK_ON = 0.0s
Then(3)
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_ES_KEY_ON,0h)
/* OBD-diagnosis on */
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
Endif(1)
/* ignition key is on after PWL */
If(1) T_DLY_CDN_OBD_PWL <> 0.0s
and
LV_IGK = 1
Then(1)
T_DLY_CDN_OBD_PWL = T_DLY_CDN_OBD_PWL - 0.01s
If(2) T_DLY_CDN_OBD_PWL = 0.0s
Then(2)
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus(NC_IDX_FID_OBD_PWL, 0)
/* OBD-diagnosis on*/
Endif(2)
Endif(1)

FARM, FARM inhibition calculation
40.6 FARM inhibition calculation
� Data De?nition
Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
LV_FID_INH [NC_NR_FID] V 0H PRMS
1H INH - -
Function inhibition provided by the fault reaction management
LV_FID_READY O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Fault reaction management is fully synchronized with all inputs
� Calibration Data
Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit

Permission returned by GetPermission in case of invalid function identi?er
� Con?guration Data
Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
NC_NR_FID - 0... FFFFH 1...65535
(0...65535) - -
Number of function permissions calculated by the fault reaction management
Note: The index of LV_FID_INH is displayed as the symbolic name of the function identi?er.
� Description:
This module provides permissions to the system GetPermission based on inputs from ERRM (Error Manage-
ment) and auxiliary inputs.

� Pre-Set Calibrations:
By software default, the display and intervention feature is disabled:
? C_STATE_FID_INH_HIS_DISP = "OFF"
? C_FID_INH_INP_DISP = "-"
? LC_FID_MAN_ENA = 0
? C_FID_MAN[*] = "-"
? C_STATE_FID_MAN[*] = "AUT"
� Description:
This module provides display visibility of inhibitions and inputs that lead to inhibitions. It also allows manual
intervention to function permissions.
In case of NLC_FID_DISP = 0 this module is disabled completely, no calibration or visible data is available.
40.7.1 Inhibition History Display
The inhibition history display lists inhibitions which became active in the past. Depending on calibration of the
mode it can also add inhibitions to the list or clear functions with permissions from the list.
? FID_INH_HIS_DISP[*]: List of (previously) inhibited functions
? CTR_FID_INH_HIS_DISP: Count of new inhbition reasons (when mode is set to NEW).
The display isupdated at reset (if calibration with activated display is ?ashed).
The mode is selected by calibration of C_STATE_FID_INH_HIS_DISP. Multiple modes can be activated at the
same time.
? "OFF": Inhibition history disabled.
? "NEW": Whenever a new reason for inhibition is detected (e.g. the input to the FARM changes its state)
the related function is added to the list
? "SCAN": The FARM recurrently scans all function permissions, inhibitions are added to the list.
? "CLR": The FARM recurrently scans the displayed functions. If a function has permission state, it is re-
moved from the list.
40.7.2 Inhibition Input Display
The input display shows inhibition inputs and related masks currently acting on one selected function.
C_FID_INH_INP_DISP is used to select the function to show inhibitions for.

FARM, FARM status information
? IDX_INP_FID_DISP[*]: Inputs acting as inhibition
? IDX_MASK_FID_DISP[*]: The mask of the inputs
? CTR_OVF_INP_FID_DISP: Inhibitions currently not displayed (in case of over?ow)
After changing the calibration catching up with the current state may take some time. At reset the display is
fully synchronized (if calibration with active display is ?ashed).
40.7.3 Manual Intervention
Permissions and inhibitions can be set manually for a limited number of functions (depending on con?guration
NC_NR_FID_MAN).
? Manual intervention will act normally even during major reinitializations (new driving cycle, clear failure
memory). It may slow down re-initialization.
? Manual intervention can be ?ashed to the ECU. It is set at reset immediately.
Manual intervention has no effect on the display modes except:
? LV_FID_INH[] will show the state taking into account the manual intervention
? In inhibition display mode "CLR" forced permissions will be cleared from the display.
Manual Intervention Calibration
? Use C_FID_MAN[*] to select functions
? Select the manual state C_STATE_FID_MAN[*]
? "AUT": Automatic, no intervention
? "PRMS": Function forced to permission
? "INH": Function forced to inhibition
? Activate the manual intervention: LC_FID_MAN_ENA = 1
If multiple interventions to the same function are selected (two ore more C_FID_MAN[*] are equal) the one with
higher index has higher priority.
FID_MAN[*] and STATE_FID_MAN[*] show active interventions (i.e. only valid interventions as de?ned by the
priority rules and activation of the manual intervention).

Okay, I have analyzed the image. Here's my assessment:

## Function

The diagram describes the architecture of the FARM (Function Inhibition Manager) module within an AUTOSAR-based automotive system. The FARM module calculates inhibition conditions based on diagnostic information from ERRM/Dem (Error and Request Reporting Manager/Diagnostic Event Manager) and other sources. It essentially determines when certain functionalities should be inhibited (disabled) based on the presence of diagnostic trouble codes (DTCs) or other fault conditions. The module is implemented on top of the Autosar module FIM (Function Inhibition Manager) with a specific extension for auxiliary inputs.

## Inputs

*   **Diagnostic Information from ERRM/Dem:** (DIAG X, DIAG Y) This is the primary input, providing the status of various diagnostic events (DTCs).
*   **Aggregated Diagnostic Data (farm.h):** Aggregate Exported Data, Aggregate Exported Actions, all NC_FIDs and NC_IDX_FIDs.  This block suggests a consolidated set of diagnostic information.
*   **Aggregated Data (AGGR XXX):** FCT X and DIAG X. Diagnostic data from various sources, likely pre-processed or aggregated.
*   **Auxiliary Inputs (T014 AuxIn Appl. Inc.):** Project-specific auxiliary inputs that can influence inhibition decisions.
*   **AUTOSAR Configuration (103P Config):** Project-specific configuration settings for the FARM module.

## Outputs

*   **Autosar EcuM, Autosar Det, Other Autosar BSW:** Information about which functions should be inhibited is output to these AUTOSAR modules.
*   **Autosar FIM:** Information about Inhibition calculation, Auxiliary Input Handler, and Status information that is used by the Autorsar FIM module.

## Logic Flow

1.  **Diagnostic Data Acquisition:** Diagnostic events (DIAG X, DIAG Y) are received from the ERRM/Dem module and possibly also via the AGGR XXX block. This data contains the status of different diagnostic checks.
2.  **Aggregation/Pre-processing:** The `farm.h` block suggests aggregation of exported data and actions based on the received diagnostic events.
3.  **AGGR adaptation:** The 301X block adapts the aggregated data to the FARM module
4.  **Auxiliary Input Handling:** Auxiliary inputs from the `T014 AuxIn Appl. Inc.` block provide additional context-specific information that can influence the inhibition decisions.
5.  **Inhibition Calculation (T015):** The `Autosar FIM` block, specifically the `T015 Inhibition calculation` block, performs the core logic for calculating the inhibition conditions. It uses the diagnostic data, auxiliary inputs, and configuration parameters to determine which functions should be inhibited.
6.  **Auxiliary Input Handling (T013):**  `T013 Auxiliary Input Handler` processes auxiliary inputs, possibly conditioning or validating them before they're used in the inhibition calculation.
7.  **Status Information (T016):** The `T016 Status information` block likely provides information about the FARM module's internal state and the calculated inhibition conditions.
8.  **Configuration (103P Config):** Configuration information is used throughout the process to tailor the behavior of the FARM module to the specific application.
9.  **Output to AUTOSAR BSW:** The final inhibition decisions are communicated to other AUTOSAR Basic Software (BSW) modules (`Autosar EcuM, Autosar Det, Other Autosar BSW`), allowing them to disable the appropriate functionalities.
10. **Autosar Exported API (FIM.h):** This interface defines the functions and data structures that other AUTOSAR modules use to interact with the FARM module.

In summary, the diagram illustrates the flow of diagnostic and other input data into the FARM module, the processing within the FARM module to determine inhibition conditions, and the communication of these conditions to other AUTOSAR modules to enforce the inhibition.
